sen.j: エビイモ（海老芋）とは、サトイモの一種。
sen.e: Ebi-imo (literally, shrimp potato) is a sort of taro.
Ebi-imo (literally, shrimp potato) is a sort of taro.
Ebi-imo (literally, shrimp potato) is a sort of taro.

sen.j: 京芋とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Kyo-imo (Kyo-taro).
It is also called Kyo-imo (Kyo-taro).
It is also called Kyo-imo (Kyo-taro).

sen.j: 京都府を中心に、主として近畿地方で消費されている。
sen.e: It is consumed mainly in the Kinki area, especially in Kyoto prefecture.
It is consumed mainly in the Kinki area, especially in Kyoto prefecture.
It is consumed mainly in the Kinki area, especially in Kyoto prefecture.

sen.j: 名称の由来は、エビのように反り返えった形をしている事やエビに似た縞模様などがある事から付けられた。
sen.e: The name comes from its bending shape and the stripes on it that look like a shrimp's.
The name comes from its bending shape and the stripes on it that make it look like a shrimp.
The name comes from its bending shape and the stripes on it that make it look like a shrimp.

sen.j: 現在、京都府・大阪府の富田林・徳島県・高知県でも作られているが、全国シェアの8割は静岡県の旧豊岡村から旧竜洋町(現磐田市)にかけての天竜川東岸で収穫されており、日本一の産地となっている。
sen.e: Although now it is produced in Kyoto prefecture, Tondabayashi in Osaka prefecture, Tokushima prefecture and Kochi prefecture, an eighty percent share of the domestic market is harvested on the eastern bank of the Tenryu river between the previous Toyooka-mura and the previous Ryuyo-cho (the present Iwata city), the biggest source of it in Japan.

Although it is now produced in Kyoto prefecture, Tondabayashi in Osaka prefecture, Tokushima prefecture and Kochi prefecture, an eighty percent share of the domestic market is harvested on the eastern bank of the Tenryu river between the previous Toyooka-mura and the previous Ryuyo-cho (the present Iwata city), the biggest source of it in Japan.

Although it is now produced in Kyoto prefecture, Tondabayashi in Osaka prefecture, Tokushima prefecture and Kochi prefecture, an eighty percent share of the domestic market is harvested on the eastern bank of the Tenryu river between the previous Toyooka-mura and the previous Ryuyo-cho (the present Iwata city), the biggest source of it in Japan.

sen.j: 又、生産量は農家の高齢化に伴い、年々減少している。
sen.e: However, the production is decreasing every year as the farmers age.
However, production is decreasing every year as the farmers age.
However, production is decreasing every year as the farmers age.

sen.j: 煮崩れせず味も良いため高級食材として扱われており、海老芋を使った料理としては京料理の芋棒が有名である。
sen.e: Ebi-imo is considered a high-grade ingredient because it does not fall apart while boiling and the taste is good; a famous dish using Ebi-imo is Imobo in Kyo-ryori (Kyoto cuisine).
Ebi-imo is considered a high-grade ingredient because it does not fall apart while boiling and the taste is good; a famous dish using Ebi-imo is Imobo in Kyo-ryori (Kyoto cuisine).
Ebi-imo is considered a high-grade ingredient because it does not fall apart while boiling and the taste is good; a famous dish using Ebi-imo is Imobo in Kyo-ryori (Kyoto cuisine).

sen.j: 茎が赤いのを唐芋(本海老)、茎が青(黄緑)いのを女芋と言う。
sen.e: Those with red stems are called tonoimo (Chinese potato) or hon-ebi, and those whose stems are green (yellow-green) are called meimo.
Those with red stems are called tonoimo (Chinese potato) or hon-ebi, and those with green stems (yellow-green) are called meimo.
Those with red stems are called tonoimo (Chinese potato) or hon-ebi, and those with green stems (yellow-green) are called meimo.

sen.j: ・芋の肉質は粉質で粘り気に富みよく締まり、風味も極めて優れている。
sen.e: ・The body of the potatoes is farinaceous, sticky and tight, and with excellent taste.
・The body of the potatoe is farinaceous, sticky and tight, and has an excellent taste.
・The body of the potato is farinaceous, sticky and tight, and has an excellent taste.

sen.j: ・煮ても煮崩れせず、色も変化しない。
sen.e: ・It does not fall apart or even change its color while boiling.
・It does not fall apart or even change its color while boiling.
・It does not fall apart or even change its color while boiling.

sen.j: ・食味は里芋の中で、最高といえる。
sen.e: ・The taste is said to be the best among taro.
・The taste is said to be the best among taro.
・The taste is said to be the best among taro.

sen.j: ・曲がった紡錐方で表面に黒い横縞がある。
sen.e: ・It has the shape of a bent spindle and black stripes on its surface.
sen.cmt: 原文「紡錐方」とありますが、この「方」は「型」または「形」のタイポと思われます。
sen.e: ・It has the shape of a bent spindle and black stripes on its surface.
・It has the shape of a bent spindle and black stripes on its surface.

sen.j: ・親から子へ次々と増えて成長するため、縁起物として重用されている。
sen.e: ・As it increases and grows from parents to children, it is valued as a bringer of good luck.
・As it increases and reproduces from parent to children, it is valued as a bringer of good luck.
・As it increases and reproduces from parent to children, it is valued as a bringer of good luck.

sen.j: ・少し甘味がある。
sen.e: ・It tastes a little sweet.
・It tastes a little sweet.
・It tastes a little sweet.

sen.j: 海老芋誕生まで
sen.e: Before the birth of ebi-imo
Before the birth of ebi-imo
Before the birth of ebi-imo

sen.j: 江戸時代の安永年間（1772～81）（18世紀後半）に、青蓮院宮〔しょうれいいんのみや〕が長崎から持ち帰った里芋の一種を、仕えていた平野権太夫（京料理「いもぼう」平野家の祖先）に栽培させたところ、大型で良質の芋が取れた。
sen.e: In the Anei era of the Edo period (1772～81, in the late eighteenth century), Prince Shorenin-no-miya had Gondayu HIRANO, his attendant and the ancestor of the Hirano family that runs a Kyoto cuisine restaurant "Imobo", grow a kind of taro, which had been brought from Nagasaki by the prince, and large, good potatoes were harvested.

In the Anei era during the Edo period (1772～81, in the late 18th century), Prince Shorenin-no-miya had Gondayu HIRANO, his attendant and the ancestor of the Hirano family that ran a Kyoto cuisine restaurant "Imobo," grow a kind of taro, which had been brought from Nagasaki by the prince, and large, good potatoes were harvested.

In the Anei era during the Edo period (1772～81, in the late 18th century), Prince Shorenin-no-miya had Gondayu HIRANO, his attendant and the ancestor of the Hirano family that ran a Kyoto cuisine restaurant "Imobo," grow a kind of taro, which had been brought from Nagasaki by the prince, and large, good potatoes were harvested.

sen.j: 土寄せを何回も行い、土の重さで湾曲した芋の形が海老に似るので、この名前がつけられた。
sen.e: The name comes from the shape of the taro, which is bent due to the weight of soil after repeatedly covering the potatoes with soil, resembling the shape of a shrimp.
The name comes from the shape of the taro, which is bent due to the weight of soil after repeatedly covering the potatoes with soil, resembling the shape of a shrimp.
The name comes from the shape of the taro, which is bent due to the weight of soil after repeatedly covering the potatoes with soil, resembling the shape of a shrimp.

sen.j: （今の京都での主産地は精華町、田辺町、舞鶴市などである。
sen.e: (The present major sources are Seika-cho, Tanabe-cho, and Maizuru city.)
(The present major sources are Seika-cho, Tanabe-cho, and Maizuru city.)
(The present major sources are Seika-cho, Tanabe-cho, and Maizuru city.)

sen.j: 磐田市に伝わるまで
sen.e: Until the introduction to Iwata city
Before it's introduction to Iwata city
Before it's introduction to Iwata city

sen.j: 昭和2年頃、旧磐田郡豊田町（旧井通村）役場の農事監督官、熊谷一郎氏が、昭和の不況対策のため新作物として導入した。
sen.e: Around 1926, Ichiro Kumagai, who was an inspector of farming at the town office of Toyoda-cho (the former Idoori Village), in the previous Iwata district, introduced ebi-imo into the area as a new crop to deal with the Showa recession.

Around 1926, Ichiro Kumagai, who was an inspector of farming at the town office of Toyoda-cho (the former Idoori Village), in the previous Iwata district, introduced ebi-imo into the area as a new crop to deal with the Showa recession.

Around 1926, Ichiro Kumagai, who was an inspector of farming at the town office of Toyoda-cho (the former Idoori Village), in the previous Iwata district, introduced ebi-imo into the area as a new crop to deal with the Showa recession.

sen.j: まず、旧豊田町気子島地区の農家によって試作され、昭和6年に出荷組合（組合長 内藤氏）によって生産販売の基礎がつくられた。
sen.e: It was first produced as a trial by a farmer in the Kegojima area in the former Toyoda cho, and in 1930, the basis for production and sales was laid by a shipping association (chair: Mr. Naito).
It was first produced as a trial by a farmer in the Kegojima area in the former Toyoda cho, and in 1930, the basis for production and sales was laid by a shipping association (chair: Mr. Naito).
It was first produced as a trial by a farmer in the Kegojima area in the former Toyoda cho, and in 1931, the basis for production and sales was laid by a shipping association (chair: Mr. Naito).

sen.j: 当時この出荷組合は気子島部落約50戸で構成され、大阪、京都、東京の問屋に出荷して、「エビイモ」の名声を誇っていた。
sen.e: At that time, this shipping association was composed of about fifty families in Kegojima, and it shipped its production to wholesale dealers in Osaka, Kyoto and Tokyo and was proud of the reputation of 'ebi-imo.'

At that time, this shipping association was composed of about 50 families in Kegojima, and it shipped its production to wholesale dealers in Osaka, Kyoto, and Tokyo and it was proud of the reputation for 'ebi-imo.'

At that time, this shipping association was composed of about 50 families in Kegojima, and it shipped its production to wholesale dealers in Osaka, Kyoto, and Tokyo and it was proud of the reputation for 'ebi-imo.'

sen.j: その後、気子島地区では海老芋栽培によって高収入をあげていることが旧竜洋町豊岡（旧掛塚町）に伝わり、昭和13～14年にかけて、当時の旧竜洋町農業協同組合長、伊藤弘氏がこれを栽培し、良好な成績を得たのをきっかけに、この地域における海老芋栽培は大きく発展した。
sen.e: After that, people in Toyooka (the former Kaketsuka-cho) in the former Ryuyo-cho learned that raising ebi-imo was bringing substantial income to the Kegojima area, and Hiroshi ITO, the head of the farmers' cooperative of the former Ryuyo-cho, grew it from in 1937 to 38 and produced good potatoes, after which start the cultivation of ebi-imo in this area has greatly developed.

After that, people in Toyooka (the former Kaketsuka-cho) in the former Ryuyo-cho learned that raising ebi-imo was bringing substantial income to the Kegojima area, and Hiroshi ITO, the head of the farmers' cooperative of the former Ryuyo-cho, grew it from in 1937 to 38 and produced good potatoes, after the start the cultivation of ebi-imo in this area greatly developed.

After that, people in Toyooka (the former Kaketsuka-cho) in the former Ryuyo-cho learned that raising ebi-imo was bringing substantial income to the Kegojima area, and Hiroshi ITO, the head of the farmers' cooperative of the former Ryuyo-cho, grew it from in 1938 to 39 and produced good potatoes, after the start the cultivation of ebi-imo in this area greatly developed.

sen.j: 昭和20年以降、同じ土壌条件である磐田市寺分、旧豊岡村広瀬地区にも急速に普及し、磐田市は海老芋産地として定着した。
sen.e: After 1945, growing ebi-imo rapidly spread in Terabun, Iwata City and the Hirose area of the former Toyooka-mura, which had the same soil conditions, and Iwata city became well-established as a site of ebi-imo production.

After 1945, growing ebi-imo rapidly spread in Terabun, Iwata City and the Hirose area of the former Toyooka-mura, which had the same soil conditions, and Iwata city became well-established as a site of ebi-imo production.

After 1945, growing ebi-imo rapidly spread in Terabun, Iwata City and the Hirose area of the former Toyooka-mura, which had the same soil conditions, and Iwata city became well-established as a site of ebi-imo production.

sen.j: （昔は10ｋｇで一万円くらいで売られていた）
sen.e: (Ebi-imo used to be sold for 10,000 yen per 10kg.)
(Ebi-imo used to be sold for 10,000 yen per 10kg.)
(Ebi-imo used to be sold for 10,000 yen per 10kg.)

sen.j: 旧豊岡村では、天竜川上流に佐久間ダム・秋葉ダムが完成したことから、洪水の心配が少なくなった昭和30年代初めに、本格的に栽培されるようになった。
sen.e: The former Toyooka-mura started to grow ebi-imo in earnest in the late 1950's, as the construction of Sakuma dam and Akiha dam at the upper reaches of the Tenryu river was completed and they did not have to worry about flooding as much as before.

The former Toyooka-mura started to grow ebi-imo in earnest during the late 1950's, as the construction of Sakuma dam and Akiha dam at the upper reaches of the Tenryu river was completed and they did not have to worry about flooding as much as before.

The former Toyooka-mura started to grow ebi-imo in earnest during the late 1950's, as the construction of Sakuma dam and Akiha dam at the upper reaches of the Tenryu river was completed and they did not have to worry about flooding as much as before.

sen.j: 当初、養蚕の後退とともに、桑に変わる転勤作物として、関西地方から導入された。
sen.e: At first it was introduced from the Kansai region to replace mulberry following the retreat of sericulture.
sen.cmt: 原文中「転勤作物」とありますが、この「転勤」が何を指すのかは調べがつきませんでした。
sen.e: At first it was introduced from the Kansai region to replace mulberry following the retreat of sericulture.
At first it was introduced from the Kansai region to replace mulberry following the retreat of sericulture.

sen.j: その後、30年代半ばになると、本場の京都や大阪周辺の海老芋の産地が、次々と住地化されていったため、中遠地方が主産地となり現在に至っている。
sen.e: After that, around 1960, as the sources of ebi-imo around the land of its birth, Kyoto and Osaka, gradually became residential areas, Chuen became the main source, and has remained so up to the present day.

After that, around 1960, as the sources of ebi-imo around the land of its birth, Kyoto and Osaka, gradually became residential areas, Chuen became the main source, and has remained so up to the present day.

After that, around 1960, as the sources of ebi-imo around the land of its birth, Kyoto and Osaka, gradually became residential areas, Chuen became the main source, and has remained so up to the present day.

sen.j: ①土を耕す
sen.e: ① Plow the land
① Plow the land
① Plow the land

sen.j: ②ビニール（マルチ）をかける
sen.e: ② Cover the land with plastic called multi
② Cover the land with plastic called multi
② Cover the land with plastic called multi

sen.j: ③種芋を植えて、水をたくさんかける
sen.e: ③ Plant potato sets and give much water
③ Plant potatoes and give much water
③ Plant potatoes and give much water

sen.j: ④種芋が育ったら親芋の葉を2、3枚とる （葉かき）
sen.e: ④ As the potato sets grow, remove two or three leaves from the parent potatoes (getting rid of unnecessary leaves)
④ As the potatoes grow, remove two or three leaves from the parent potatoes (get rid of unnecessary leaves)
④ As the potatoes grow, remove two or three leaves from the parent potatoes (get rid of unnecessary leaves)

sen.j: ⑤土を寄せる 少しずつ何回も繰り返す （土寄せ）
sen.e: ⑤ Cover the roots of potatoes with soil (tsuchi-yose). Do it a little bit at a time and repeat several times.
⑤ Cover the roots of potatoes with soil (tsuchi-yose). Do it a little bit at a time and repeat several times.
⑤ Cover the roots of potatoes with soil (tsuchi-yose). Do it a little bit at a time and repeat several times.

sen.j: ⑥葉が少し枯れてきたら収穫
sen.e: ⑥Harvest the potatoes when the leaves start to die
⑥Harvest the potatoes when the leaves start to die
⑥Harvest the potatoes when the leaves start to die

sen.j: 「土寄せ」という親芋由来の茎と子芋由来の茎の間に土を入れる作業をしないと、子芋が親芋から離れないので、本来の海老芋のように湾曲した形にならない。
sen.e: Without 'tsuchi-yose', the putting of soil between the stems coming from the parent potatoes and those from the smaller potatoes, the smaller (koimo) would not part and they would not acquire the basic bent shape of ebi-imo.

Without 'tsuchi-yose', the putting of soil between the stems coming from the parent potatoes and those from the smaller potatoes, the smaller (koimo) will not part and they will not acquire the basic bent shape of ebi-imo.

Without 'tsuchi-yose', the putting of soil between the stems coming from the parent potatoes and those from the smaller potatoes, the smaller (koimo) will not part and they will not acquire the basic bent shape of ebi-imo.

sen.j: 肉付きの良い海老芋を生産するには、肥沃な透水性のある適度な湿度が保たれる土壌であることが望ましい。
sen.e: To produce heavy ebi-imo, it is desirable to have rich, permeable soil and maintain the soil at an appropriate humidity.
To produce heavy ebi-imo, it is desirable to have rich, permeable soil and maintain the soil at an appropriate humidity.
To produce heavy ebi-imo, it is desirable to have rich, permeable soil and maintain the soil at an appropriate humidity.

sen.j: また種芋の大きさは、40ｇ～80ｇ（大きさは揃える）が良い。
sen.e: Also, the best size for the potato sets is between 40 and 80g. (Be sure to make them all the same size.)
Also, the best size for the potato sets is between 40 and 80g. (Be sure to make them all the same size.)
Also, the best size for the potato sets is between 40 and 80g. (Be sure to make them all the same size.)

sen.j: 10aあたりでの種芋の数は、800～900個必要である。
sen.e: The number of potato sets necessary per 10a is approximately from 800 to 900.
The number of potato sets necessary per 10a is approximately from 800 to 900.
The number of potato sets necessary per 10a is approximately from 800 to 900.

sen.j: 栽培上重要なことは、施肥の量と時期である。
sen.e: The important thing while growing ebi-imo is the amount and timing of fertilizer.
The important thing while growing ebi-imo is the amount and the timing of adding fertilizer.
The important thing while growing ebi-imo is the amount and the timing of adding fertilizer.

sen.j: 海老芋は肥料障害を受けやすいため、植え付け時の決定は土壌の水分状態を見て行い、植え付けは雨降直後土が充分湿気を保っている時が良い。
sen.e: Because ebi-imo is likely to be damaged by fertilizer, the decision of when to plant should be taken with consideration for the water in the soil, and it is better to do the planting just after the rain when the soil is wet enough.

Because ebi-imo is likely to be damaged by fertilizer, the decision of when to plant should be taken with consideration of the water in the soil, and it is better to do the planting just after a rain when the soil is wet enough.

Because ebi-imo is likely to be damaged by fertilizer, the decision of when to plant should be taken with consideration of the water in the soil, and it is better to do the planting just after a rain when the soil is wet enough.

sen.j: 土が乾燥気味の時は、2週間前に施した肥料でも障害が出る場合があり、従って乾燥しているときは、灌水する必要がある。
sen.e: When the soil is getting dry, even fertilizer given two weeks ago can cause damage, making irrigation necessary in dry periods.
When the soil becomes dry, even fertilizer added two weeks prior can cause damage, making irrigation necessary in dry periods.
When the soil becomes dry, even fertilizer added two weeks prior can cause damage, making irrigation necessary in dry periods.

sen.j: 灌水不可能な場合は、元肥を種芋の下に施さないで株間に施すように留意する。
sen.e: If irrigation is impossible, be sure to lay the initial manure not under each potato set but between them.
If irrigation is impossible, be sure to lay the initial manure not under each potato set, but between them.
If irrigation is impossible, be sure to lay the initial manure not under each potato set, but between them.

sen.j: 追肥を施す場合でも、細心の注意と工夫が必要で、例えば追肥を4回に分施するのも肥料障害回避のためである。
sen.e: When applying additional fertilizer, the closest attention and care are necessary; for example, spreading the additional fertilizer out over four times to avoid any damage due to fertilizer.
When applying additional fertilizer, the closest attention and care are necessary; for example, spreading additional fertilizer over four times to avoid any damage due to fertilizer.
When applying additional fertilizer, the closest attention and care are necessary; for example, spreading additional fertilizer over four times to avoid any damage due to fertilizer.

sen.j: その他、特記すべきことは、摘葉、摘茎が子芋の肥大に欠かせない農業の一つである。
sen.e: Other than the above, one thing especially worth mentioning is that removing leaves and stems is one of the essential farming techniques needed to make the smaller potatoes larger.
Other than the above, one thing especially worth mentioning is that removing leaves and stems is one of the essential farming techniques needed to make the smaller potatoes larger.
Other than the above, one thing especially worth mentioning is that removing leaves and stems is one of the essential farming techniques needed to make the smaller potatoes larger.

sen.j: 親芋の茎葉を除去し、親芋の葉の先端が湾曲し、十分展開しないことは、子芋の肥大に好影響を及ぼす。
sen.e: Removing the stems and leaves of the parent potatoes, making the tips of their leaves curved and preventing them from too much spreading will have a beneficial effect on the growth of smaller potatoes.
Removing the stems and leaves of the parent potatoes, makes the tips of their leaves curved, preventing them from spreading too much will have a beneficial effect on the growth of smaller potatoes.
Removing the stems and leaves of the parent potatoes, makes the tips of their leaves curved, preventing them from spreading too much will have a beneficial effect on the growth of smaller potatoes.
